moduleMetadataJson.name: DHCP Client Bash Environment Variable Code Injection (Shellshock)
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This module exploits the Shellshock vulnerability, a flaw in how the Bash shell
        handles external environment variables. This module targets dhclient by responding
        to DHCP requests with a malicious hostname, domainname, and URL which are then
        passed to the configuration scripts as environment variables, resulting in code
        execution.
author: scriptjunkie
apconole <apconole@yahoo.com>
Stephane Chazelas
Ramon de C Valle <rcvalle@metasploit.com>

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: SRVHOST
options.description: The IP of the DHCP server

options.name: NETMASK
options.description: The netmask of the local subnet

options.name: DHCPIPSTART
options.description: The first IP to give out

options.name: DHCPIPEND
options.description: The last IP to give out

options.name: BROADCAST
options.description: The broadcast address to send to

options.name: FILENAME
options.description: The optional filename of a tftp boot server
